intro: Leiothrix flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered leiothrix, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental value. The plant is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Leiothrix flavescens is valued in horticulture for its attractive foliage and subtle floral display.
